Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cyntia n
Reviews.Content: Rooms are way too small for the price... No closet space and the thermostat on the ac/heat didn't work... It has a good location and the complimentary breakfast is always nice, but I don't think we'll be staying there again. We love Holiday Inn Express, but this was a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but hotel is old.”
Reviews.Author: Tbone3672
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff that was more than helpful. Rooms were clean and nice. Hotel had problems that seemed to be from getting old. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE NIGHTS SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: PoloBear52
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend and had a very goodnights rest. Really friendly staff (Jessica) and yummy cinnamon rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Old, not very clean”
Reviews.Author: Diverguysmom
Reviews.Content: Most holiday inn express have microwaves and mini fridge. This one did not. Executive suite very small. Toilet leaked for about 8 hours before they came to fix it. We had to place all the towels on the floor to soak up the water. Stains on the walls and carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Attkica
Reviews.Content: Short cab ride to Beale Street. A few fast food type restaurants close by. Hotel was nice and clean. All of the employees were very nice and helpful. There was security onsite in the evening. The breakfast was not much to talk about. There was no hot water in the hotel during the two nights we stayed. It appears the hotel is not equipped to handle a sellout.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: juliemun
Reviews.Content: This location was easy to find and convenient to many different Memphis attractions. It was close to Beale Street, yet far enough away to be quiet. The hotel was very clean, attractive, and well maintained. Amenities included a full hot breakfast, wireless internet, fitness center, and free parking. Overall, very satisfied. We would definitely stay there again the next time we're in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Great HIE, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jason9945
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to the Trolley to go into Downtown/Beale. Far enough away to be quiet at night. Older property but very well maintained. As for the neighbourhood its clean and quiet by Memphis standards. I don't know where in Memphis is less sketchy, but I can think of lots of places that are more sketchy!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access location”
Reviews.Author: 2CAtravelers
Reviews.Content: It appears to be an older hotel/motel that was made over into a Holiday Inn Express sometime in the last decade. It has all the features of a typical Holiday Inn Express and is well maintained. There is plenty of free parking on site. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even down to helping direct us to a restaurant downtown. It's very convenient to I-440 and the medical center. It's about a 5 minute drive into downtown as well as into the Victorian historic district. For us it was a perfect choice for our Memphis visit. We were extremely glad we didn't choose to stay right downtown on Beale Street due to parking issues and noise from the drunken party people. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Works For Certain Circumstances”
Reviews.Author: thedailyguru
Reviews.Content: First off, if you're looking to partake in the nightlife of Memphis or late nights on Beale Street, this is probably not the place for you. It is a short drive from those areas, and for a number of reasons, NOT a walkable distance. That being said, I stayed here for a few days to attend a few different events and a concert, all scattered around the Memphis area. The hotel worked great for my needs, and though I rarely notice it, I have to admit that the breakfast offerings were far more impressive than most places I've been in the US. As noted in other reviews, the neighborhood isn't bad, but it can be a bit sketchy late at night. However, whether we were heading down to Beale Street or one of the local concert venues, the location worked great. Also, the hotel is very easy to find and is a quick drive from the airport. The rooms were comfortable for both my friend and I, and the wireless internet was reliable in terms of both signal and speed. There was also ample workspace, as both my friend and I had a decent amount of work we needed to get done during our stay. Overall, it was a positive experience, and I would certainly stay here again when I next visit the Memphis area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamonsage
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overall nice. There rooms are pretty expensive, we booked for a wednesday through a 3rd party(expedia) and paid $101 bucks. We notice some mystery stains on the linen and could not determine if the bed was dressed with clean or dirty linen. We also made it to breakfast around 6:50am and notice the guy removing the bacon from the breakfast area without returning anymore. When he was asked about the bacon, he said that was it for the day. So if you want meat with your breakfast, it is best to get there between the hour of 6:00am-7:00am. The rest of the breakfast experience was pretty great, they even have a machine that makes pancakes, all you have to do is push a button. The also provide their customers with free popcorn, tea, and coffee throughout the day which is great. They also have a list in the elevator with all of the recent and upcoming events in the area listed. Nice hotel and nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but you can see it from here.”
Reviews.Author: Badrhino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid July 2011. The hotel is right downtown near the medical center (hence the hotel name). The area is a little rough, but not at all bad for Memphis. The hotel is a little dated and felt dirty compared to other hotels. Specifically, the carpet and walls were dirty, and there was vomit on the rocks just outside the door. The staff seemed fairly indifferent to my questions and needs and were just not especially helpful. On the positive side, the location worked well for us, and the fitness room was surprisingly well equipped; the pool was also all right. Basic restaurants and shopping needs were conveniently located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't look forward to staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Terry9
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel included: a good location, a nice sized and well kept outdoor pool, nice staff, a good complimentary breakfast (with those yummy cinnamon rolls) and clean, comfortable beds and bathroom fixtures. The downside is that some areas of the hotel and rooms are not cleaned well. The hall carpeting was awful. A lot of stains and unvacuumed debris. In our room, the floors and walls didn't seem to be addressed well and the cleaning of corners and nooks and crannies seemed to be being ignored. Also, the bathroom was extremely small and the door was heavy and hard to close. We weren't sure what to make of the "carrot" smell our kids mentioned when swimming. The pool looked clean, so we aren't sure if this is a different kind of treatment process. They did enjoy the pool, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates/good location”
Reviews.Author: msblueyes32
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the reception desk staff were courteous and quick. The free breakfast included the most interesting pancake maker! We were only an easy 10 minutes from Beale St and other downtown attractions. We were only passing thru but would stay here again if we visit Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripperOregon
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. There was a little back up of getting people into their rooms when we arrived, but the staff did their best to get everyone settled in. The entire staff, right down to housekeeping, was very friendly. The room was spacious and clean. We did have a car and the hotel was just minutes from Beale St and the river. We were given a small goody bag when we checked in and I thought that was a nice touch. Afternoon popcorn and a little later fresh cookies also made for a nice stay. The breakfast was nice. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but located away Memphis Downtown night life”
Reviews.Author: ERRveneno
Reviews.Content: this hotel is good, but it is placed as it name says, for people visiting the medical center. If going there for adventures in Memphis, then this is not the place unless you have a car for yourself. It is away like 4 km from downtown, so donÂ´t try going into Beale St and get drunk because maybe you wonÂ´t know your final destination. Rooms (335) are not so roomy but accordingly, sleep quality is ok, air conditioning can be noisy. what ever you have around is Junk food, every thing is little away.

Reviews.Title: “Showing lots of wear.”
Reviews.Author: jcmmhuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the end of May with my family. Lobby and staff were okay, but things went downhill from there. Hallway carpeting was heavily stained. Upon entering room, the bedskirts were frayed and torn in several places. Entire drawer face came off in my hands when I tried to pull the drawer out. Room was quite small. The countertop around the sink was cracked, and when I changed out the toilet tissue in the dispenser, the amount of filth behind where the roll sits was disgusting. Simply not up to usual Holiday Inn Express standards. On a positive note, the staff was friendly, and breakfast was good. Popcorn in the lobby in the afternoon was a nice touch. We stayed the next night at the Holiday Inn Express Opryland in Nashville, and the difference was startling. What a beautiful clean hotel that one was!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was unprofessional and unhelpful and the room was dirty.”
Reviews.Author: JV101
Reviews.Content: I had a reservtaion and tried to check in at 4:45PM but there we no rooms ready (3PM is check-in). When I asked why, the front desk agent (who seemed to be either high or doped up) told me to "come back in a few hours" and that they "only has one maid who was working that day and she was behind." I came back after 7PM and a different front desk attendant told me that I was too late and my reserved room type (2 double beds) was NOT available. I was on buisness and a king bed would not suffice. After much haggling and being treated like I was a huge inconvenience to her personal phone call, I was placed in a room with double beds that "just happened to have opened up moments ago." Once I got to the room, the "non-smoking" room smelled terrible and the bathroom was filthy. By this time, I was so exasperated that I went to Walgreens myself and bought some cleaning supplies. Finally, the "hot deluxe" breakfast was an absolute joke. Don't let the photos they have on the billboard near the hotel fool you. I have stayed in dozens of Holiday Inns and have never had an experience like this. The ONLY positive was the location-- very convenient to downtown offices and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “a surprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: goodhead14
Reviews.Content: I stayed there two nights and found just about everything about the place to be ideal: clean, secure, quiet room, and most importantly, the friendliest most helpful staff that I have ever run into. The exercise room a wee bit larger than most found in this rank of hotel. I was especially pleased with the morning breakfast which had lots of variety and was different on the two mornings I visited it. If you need a refrigerator in your room, make sure to request it when making your reservation. The Midtown location is interesting: some seediness, but also some beautifully landscaped homes. Easy drive to downtown and also to the best barbecue places in Memphis. AND Memphis has got to be THE friendliest city in the USA. Everywhere I went I was treated with courtesy and pleasant conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Karol33423
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed staying at Holiday Inn Express and looked forward to our stay at this one. Our reservation was made 10 days prior to arrival and we expected we would have two beds for myself and grandaughter, age 14. When we checked in, however, we were told that the only room left was one with just one double bed! Sure enough, my confirmation stated that while "all rooms are guaranteed to sleep the number of guests you provided during your search", they cannot guarantee the number of beds. Beware! Both of us had a very poor night's sleep as a result, and I will be extremely wary of booking Holiday Inn Express next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, nice pool, convienent location”
Reviews.Author: cooperpd
Reviews.Content: With this HIE you get a nice midtown location directly across the street from Methodist Hospital. It's 2 miles to downtown / Beale St. For the adventurous, walk Union Street downtown or take the Madison St. trolley located 2 blocks behind and 2 blocks east of the hotel. Room 133 faces the pool. A walk-in price with discounts was $107/nt. The room had a king bed, dresser, night stands, desk, chair, easy chair and ottoman, flat panel tv. An expanded breakfast included the basic cereals, biscuits, sausage gravy, bananas, coffee, juice, milk, etc. Free WiFi internet. There was a computer available for use in the lobby. Problem: The carpeting, while vacuumed, was dirty. Walking around the room barefoot I got dirty feet. I had to place towels on the carpet after I showered to keep my feet clean. NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: Carpeting needs to be SHAMPOOED and USE BETTER VACUUMS to remove more dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully, caring people who go out of their way to help!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: buxombrunette
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel the night before my daughter had to be at Le Bonheur Children's Hospital for surgery. The front desk clerk, Krystal, was so sweet and helpful. I had reserved the room for my daughter, her boyfriend, and myself, but at the last minute my mom decided to go with us. The room I'd reserved had 2 double beds, so I had to call and have a rollaway bed put in our room for my teenage daughter's boyfriend. Krystal made sure that we got the rollaway bed, and it was set up in the room when we arrived. When we had to venture out, we came upon two ladies who were cleaning the other hotel rooms. Both spoke to us and were very cordial. Later, they came to our room with extra linens for the rollaway bed and were again, so very nice!!! It was truly refreshing to have someone work with us who was NICE!!!! The next morning, all of us except my daughter went down to breakfast. There was a variety of foods there that were fresh and tasty. The selection included fresh fruit, biscuits, YUMMMY cinnamon rolls, muffins, bacon, cheese omelets, milk, juice ( apple, orange, and cranberry), yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea, boiled eggs, and more that I've fogotten about! We certainly enjoyed out breakfast. The bottom line is this......this is a super hotel to stay at, and we'll be back again in July when my daughter has to return to Le Bonheur. They offer a reduced rate for patients and their families of both Le Bonheur and St. Jude's. Caring, nice, super people to work with.........a great place to stay, great beds, clean and safe......what more could you ask for?!?!?!?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great time in midtown memphis”
Reviews.Author: elvisrox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on June 12th to attend a concert at Minglewood Hall (GREAT venue), which is a $6 dollar cab ride from the hotel. I got the room on Hotwire for $64, which was awesome. It was in midtown, which is a nice part of Memphis. The girls at check-in were sweet and gave us a fantastic restaurant recommendation. If you stay here, you must go down the road about a mile and go to Pei Wei's. It's like a tiny little PF Changs. AWESOME! The rooms were bigger than I thought with a small couch, coffee table and desk. The t.v. was a nice flat screen and the bed was INCREDIBLE! Soooooooo comfy. BUT, I am highly allergic to down and I didn't realize the pillows were down until I laid my head on it and woke up with swollen eyes. Hotels really need to let guests know if down is in the room. The bathroom was roomy with a coffee maker and toiletries. The air worked great and we had a room overlooking the pool, which was nice. The lobby has Otis Spunkenmyer cookies which we took more than our share of b/c they rocked! In the morning, the have Cinnabon-like cinnamon rolls. Drool. Every employee we saw smiled and spoke to us. I went outside at night to my car and there was a security guard patrolling the hotel. They offer a nice continental breakfast but we slept in. I will for sure go back. And for the people who care about this kind of thing, some of the carpet was worn and there were tiny chips on some of the door but honestly, I don't look that close. My husband pointed all that out. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, but not as clean as my last stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Tudaloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February and I wrote a very positive review for this hotel. I cannot give as glowing a review this time. The staff is still extremely helpful and friendly. However, the room we were given needed vacuuming and I had to finally ask to have it done. In addition, each day the housekeeper asked if we needed our room cleaned instead of just automatically coming in to freshen it up. However, the staff were extremely apologetic about the less than perfectly clean room and the next day I found a small bag of candy in the room as an apology. The room needs an overall cleaning of walls, etc. but I would still recommend staying here because of the wonderful staff, the free and very ample breakfast that is offered, free parking, and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirelass80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights as went for Memphis in May. Hotel is a bit out of town but easy to get to by either tram (5 minute walk to stop) or bus (just outside hotel). Took a taxi back at night for less than $10. Room clean and tidy and adequate bathroom (counter top room a bit on the small side). However the drawers in the room really need attending to as they were awkward to open. It wasn't too warm when we were there but I guess the air conditioning could be a bit noisy at night in warm weather. Only complaint is that in Holiday Inn Express hotels the windows don't open. The staff were great - really friendly and helpful. Didn't use the swimming pool so can't comment on that but would really recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Emilys Memphis Trip”
Reviews.Author: 1969LF
Reviews.Content: Tha staff are still as excellent as they were on our first vist here 2+1/2 years ago..lways polite, have to mention RIchard at the breakfast every morming who was more than helpful to us, as was Carol om Mangers duties... Rooms nice and clean and tidy, if the double beds were a bit bigger it would be helpful,but they are so comfy.., but other that that, it was again a great visit to HIE

Reviews.Title: “A delight! great staff, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EdistoWill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this downtown motel while helping our daughter relocate to Memphis. We chose this motel due to our belief that we would know what to expect from a Holiday Inn Express and that is was nearby to our daughter's new apartment. We were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness, and quietness of our accomodations and at the friendliness of the staff. The parking was ample. The water pressure of the shower was not the best, but perhaps this is a trend as facilities seek to conserve resources. The morning free buffet included eggs and bacon. Several employees kept things well maintained. Everything was nice and clean. Next time I'll ask for a room further away from the elevators. There were a few minor instances of noisy quests, but all in all things were pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean with Friendly Employees”
Reviews.Author: BlackCatBelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend on a NY's eve trip to Memphis. The front desk clerk was very helpful and polite when we checked in and out. The room was exceptionally clean, the bed comfy and everything in working order. The bathroom looked as if it had recently been remodeled and all was sparkling clean. I have no complaints and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Need A Complete Turn Over!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PRETTYBOY23
Reviews.Content: I was here in Memphis, Tn on business with a big company that used this hotel a lot ( hope not for long ) First of all when I called to book my reservation I was put on hold for 30min then put on hold again for 10min Upset I was after making reservation the clerk was no help with location details on room and ect. She quoted her self to be the Supervisor WoW could not believe the ATTITUDE RUDE !!!! After checking in by Quoeda she was more into taking a smoke break then anything Remember I am a club member as well no welcome no upgrade just checked in gave keys to room after entering my room DIRTY sheets bathroom tub DIRTY Towels were stained I came down to the front desk the young lady suppose to be the Supervisor at the front door SMOKING and looking at me like WHAT?? I then stated to her I am a club member and that room seems to not be clean may I have a free upgrade i am a platium member she states I don't have any free upgrades and with attitude put keys to another room on the counter and walk to the back on her cell phone after i enter in the other room it smell bad tub was marked up I notified my travel agent and stated to never book me back at this hotel what a stay the breakfast was not hot or station seem not clean coffee was not good this place needs a change of HEART!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not disaster ready”
Reviews.Author: LoshWVU
Reviews.Content: This was your typical Holiday Inn Express. It was clean, well kept, and the new hot breakfast was a pleasant surprise. The neighborhood seemed a little scary, but actually once I got out and around it wasn't that bad at all. Some fast food and local restuarants within walking distance, but you're better off driving as crossing some of those streets is dangerous. My only major compliant was the lack of communication during a severe weather event. I was there when a number of tornados passed through the surrounding area. One tornado even brushed the SE corner of the city near the airport. Although the hotel was not in the path the local tornado sirens went off then and several other times. Not once did I hear a PA announcement or recieve a phone call on what to do. I figured they would have a way of communicating to the guests the best course of action to take. I'm from the Mountains. I did not know what to do in the event of a tornado. It would have been nice to have some communication from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: OldHoo72
Reviews.Content: Since we had a family member in the hospital across the street, we stayed at the Holiday inn for 10 days. We have stayed before when it was a Hampton Inn. The Holiday Inn is a great value. They have a low "hospital" rate of $79 per night. The hotel is clean, quiet and the beds & pillows are very comfortable. The free breakfast is adequate, especially considering the low price of the rooms. The staff was friendly & helpful, they have free internet access in the lobby and a decent fitness room. The location is good, right across the street from the hospital and just a short drive to either downtown or midtown. The neighborhood isn't the best, I wouldn't go wandering at night, but it doesn't have a downright dangerous feel to it either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DavidJG
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights from 30th September 2007 and pleased that I did. Typical HI Express for the States (better standard than HI Express in UK). Efficient registration, given up grade without asking as priority club member. Rooms comfortable and clean. Breakfast nothing special but hot drinks on offer 24 hours and always complimentary snack available in the evening. Just what you want when you come in at night. Just off Interstate and on main bus route. If you want to get downtown though suggest you use trolly bus. 5 minutes walk from hotel and great value at $1. By intersection to get down to Graceland (10 minutes) and 2 minutes from Sun Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Barricade the door!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fab2008
Reviews.Content: I was in Memphis for a one day conference and chose this hotel because 1) close porximity to the conference center 2) it had good reviews from other users and 3) the other conference hotels were sold-out. Although the hotel is clean and the front-desk personnel are decent, there is no full-time, on-duty general manager. I have never heard of that! On to the good stuff. Upon arrival to our room, we were greeted by a couple having a fight in the hallway (12:15AM) We arrived super late at the property and I was looking forward to a solid 5 hours sleep before our wakeup call. No need for a wakeup call here! At 4AM I was awakened by a young couple (different from the first) TRYING TO OPEN MY DOOR with a handful of different card-keys!!! As my door was securely locked, they then proceeded to the two doors across the hall - then who knows what. Unfortunately I did not call the police as I was trying to eek out one more hour of sleep before my 6AM wakeup call. When I reported this to the front desk, they were not very interested. Do I really need to comment on the next night?????????

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jango31
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at half the price of other hotels in Memphis. Located at Medical Centre [don,t let this address put you of staying there] It,s about 2 miles from Beale Street and Downtown Memphis. Must visit Rendevouz restraunt great atmosphere and ribs.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: I_Cant_Decide
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by the hotel. The room is very small and cramped and while it may be clean, it doesn't feel clean. The grout in the bathroom has some mold in it and also doesn't feel clean. While I was checking in, a man came in asking about the rate to stay at the hotel and how much cash he would need to "bring" -- then he said he'd have to go across the street and talk to his wife and asked to buy an apple. The desk clerk said no and looked at him very suspiciously. The entire interaction made me nervous and want to move to a different hotel (but it is late and I am here for only one night). Usually Hampton Inns are newish and clean and modern -- this is not that way. I will say, however, that the A/C works very well and the bed is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “FIne stay”
Reviews.Author: TraderD
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night without any problems. Rooms typical of a Hampton Inn, what i expected for $99. Hotel was at capacity, no issues with the parking. As a former Memphis resident I can understand peoples comments about the area, but the area is actually improved since I lived there 8 years ago. Parking lot is well lit and fenced, but not gated. Access to hotel from rear requires room key. Arrived after 11 pm and felt safe. Outdoor pool was clean, breakfast had a good variety and was kept stocked. Would stay again if i needed to be in the midtown/UT area. Restaurant recommendation: Blue Fish on South Cooper@ Young, less than 10 minutes away, great seafood which is hard to find in memphis, $20 price range for entrees, highly recommeded. They provide parking 2 doors down on Cooper for $5 (parking can be difficult in Cooper-Young area), get your ticket validated by your server and the attendent will refund your $5 on the way out. Lots of fun little shops in the area also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last night and found the front desk staff to be very friendly, the room was clean, neat, and comfortable (my only complaint is a little mold in the grout around the shower), breakfast this Morning was typical Hampton Inn quality (they did not have the eggs or sausage), checkout was quick and friendly. After reading the previous review about "unsavory area" I asked the cab driver if the area around the hotel was safe and he stated it was. Perhaps the previous reviewer is not accustom to "urban areas."

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having reserved two adjoining non-smoking rooms, we received instead rooms on two different floors, one of which was a smoking room. Staff could only say "I guess we overbooked." Housekeeping also left the door open to one of our rooms after cleaning which we discovered after coming back to the room late at night - - pretty creepy. No A/C in halls or elevators added to an overall unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Out of Toilet Paper - July 23”
Reviews.Author: TravelForWork2007
Reviews.Content: By far, this was my worst experience with a Hampton Inn. We requested a non-smoking room and received a "non-smoking" room that smelled like it HAD been a smoking room up until the time we checked in. This was a family vacation and in all we reserved five rooms for three nights. The hotel was out of toilet paper. We ended up buying some for our room. The hotel was also out of shampoo. We had to wait for clean towels each and every day. One day, we only had one set of clean towels. It was 11:00pm before we could get more. Ridiculously pitiful service. The only plus would be that it is convenient too all of the tourist attractions, the continental b'fast was above average, and the nightly rate was reasonable. Oh, and before I forget, for some unGodly reason, they weren't running the air in the hallways or elevator. The manager said that there was no problem with the AC, so I am assuming they were just cheap and didn't want to run it in the 100+ degree temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ecs
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 3 night stay here. The staff was competent, friendly, and helpful. The general appearance of the rooms, corridors and the lobby were very good. The pool area was well maintained. I was surprised to find a much better rate on the Hampton Inn site than on Orbitz or Hotels.com. I thought Beale St might be walkable from here - it isn't unless you like walking along major traffic arteries through an industrial area. Fortunately, it's a short drive downtown and parking was available and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway. Not bad location, only 2 miles from Beale Street. This seems to be an older building that has been refurbished. the rooms are clean but showing age. bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly. Breakfast needs a bit of work. I have stayed in other Hampton Inns and had a much better breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “No Blues at Hampton in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and friendly and worked to get us into our room early. Nice quiet atmosphere, good variety in the continental breakfast (also a packed breakfast to go if you are on the run). It is a bit of a walk to Beale street, but not bad on a beautiful Memphis morning, and only about 10 minutes to Graceland by car! Stay here with confidence!

Reviews.Title: “this is a good one”
Reviews.Author: Chevstriss
Reviews.Content: this is a very good hampton. I come to a convention same time every yr, and the skanky hotel which they put us at was full last yr, so I chose the Hampton. I'm so glad. It was cheaper, cleaner and had more to offer than the hotel I was supposed to be at.My luggage missed a connection and arrived safely at the hampton by midnight that night.A good experience all around for me, including the breakfast (which the convention hotel did not offer).BTW the convention no longer deals w/ the skanky hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay at this Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several Hampton Inns over the years, and this one wasn't much better or worse than the others overall. We did have a problem with our shower the first day, but we were moved to a comparable room without much fuss from the folks at the front desk. The hotel staff was friendly enough, and willing to help with directions and such; however, the rooms were average and the free breakfast wasn't anything to write home about. The nice thing about this hotel was that it wasn't a far drive to downtown Memphis or Graceland. There isn't much going on (besides hospitals) in the immediate area, but since Memphis is so big that you'll have to drive anyway, it doesn't really matter. I don't know if I would go out of my way to stay at this particular Hampton Inn again, but it was affordable and the rooms were alright, so it wasn't a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Is very nice....the continental breakfast is really nice...good variety and the rates are reasonable. This particular one is not far from Beale St.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express - Medical Center Midtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1180 Union Avenue, Memphis, TN 38104
